title: Scarlet fever
description: Scarlet fever is an infection that mostly affects young children. It’s easily treated with antibiotics.

header.value: Scarlet fever is an infection that mostly affects young children. It’s easily treated with antibiotics.

value.caption: A pink-red rash comes out, which feels like sandpaper and looks like sunburn. It starts on the chest and tummy.
value.alt: Lots of small, flat, pink spots joined up as red patches on white skin covering the neck, chest, shoulders and tummy

value.caption: A white coating also appears on the tongue. This peels leaving it red and swollen (known as strawberry tongue).
value.alt: A swollen, reddened tongue partly covered with a white coating

value.caption: The rash doesn’t appear on the face, but the cheeks can be flushed.
value.alt: A small child’s face with bright red cheeks
